title: Sett is the most balanced champion on release since forever
body:
with a stable 50% across all elo and region, with the only exception of Iron and Bronze facetanking Sett W.

Can we have more champion like this?
Counterplay wise and gameplay wise this champion is awesome.

He feels strongs to play and has clear weakness.

And please don't nerf him for low elo like you did to Yorick, they need to learn it the hard way and understand the basic of this game. If they get good then good for them, but the majority of the average should not have their champion nerfed because of them. Example: Yorick.

replies.body: Because unlike many other recent champions, they decided to give an actual, exploitable weakness without giving him 20 ways to overcome it. Giving champions a clear and exploitable weakness is pivotal game design that seems to be forgotten as of late.

> Because unlike many other recent champions, they decided to give an actual, exploitable weakness without giving him 20 ways to overcome it. Giving champions a clear and exploitable weakness is pivotal game design that seems to be forgotten as of late.

True to that. Other recent releases - involved champions with absurd kits (champions capable of doing free damage - since there was no way of punishing them - and on top of that.. their kit also involved heal, shield, evasive abilities and cc). There's a complete lack of common sense behind their kit - for a moba game (it's as if those champs were made for a brainless hack and slash mmo - where you need a swiss knife kit for the sake of entertainment - cause grinding till lvl 180 can be quite boring with the usual LoL kit - as champs used to be made).
If he has 50 % winrate in his first week, he's not balanced, he is op.
He's an easy to pick up champion, it's not going to be hard to use him.

I guess you can say he has an easy Sett-up

Also, sett is *incredibly simple*

Well this circle jerk of a board seems to believe that Fiora with her 49-50% w/r is broken and needs to be gutted so its reasonable to use the same logic for other champs, no?

fiora is supposed to be a high skill cap skirmisher. Instead, she basically insta wins lane against any melee, and even if she loses, she has the tools to win, due to the q buff allowing her to just sit in lane and push like a female tryndamere.

Out of all the melee carries, she (imo) has the easiest time in and out of lane while also spiking incredibly hard. 

And you may ask me, "if she's so strong, why not play her?" The simple answer is, she's boring. Either you face someone who doesn't know what they are doing, and you get fed by just q spamming into them, or you face someone who does know what they are doing, and they just sit back and farm, with you eventually just running down a side lane until you either get fed enough to 1v9, or your team wins or loses  without you.

>He feels strongs to play and has clear weakness.

what are his clear weaknesses? I've played him into pretty much every matchup and he seems like a very good generalist to me right now, unless his weakness is his low carry potential

He has an 83 WR above plat, his abilities are on crack of a cooldown, allowing him to use it 2, even 3 times in a lane engagement at times, and his shield gives him his ENTIRE health back is used properly. His balance is laughable ATM.

People said the same about Senna, she had about a 51% win rate the first week and then it spiked to 54% once people learned to play her. Sett has extremely one sided matchups, he either stomps who's he's playing against or he gets wrecked by them. 

https://u.gg/lol/champions/sett/matchups?rank=overall

His shield is obnoxious and his W is overloaded because of it. Sure his other abilities are fine but having one ability that powerful that carries the rest of your kit means you're not really balanced. He's not broken but I do think he's overtuned in some areas. We'll see how he does in the next few weeks.

God, it's been ages. I'd say the last time I saw a champion have so few balance issues was Kayn.   

{{champion:523}} : Has continued to piss people off since his recent release with his waaaaaay too awkward to play against kit.  
 
{{champion:235}} : Was and is pretty strong, and will probably continue to be a problem as either an ADC or support at any one time.  
 
{{champion:246}} : was extremely strong, and saw very high p/b of 90% at worlds, despite her nerfs.   
  
{{champion:350}} : ... Exists. Remember her 80% slow? I wish I didn't.  
 
{{champion:517}} :  Has seen a huge amount of work since release due to having both a strong base kit and far too versatile ultimate(s).

{{champion:518}} : Lowkey stronk. Looking back though her patch history, she saw quite a few nerfs I'd forgotten about. Also caused chaos up top with her on hit build. Like, her W passive damage got reduced by almost 25%. 
  
{{champion:555}} : Hoo boy. Basically had to remove all of his wave clear due to a certain EU team, saw changes to make tank Pyke less viable, and people are still pissed about the buffs to his ult's gold generation. Turns out mixing an assassin with a support is like mixing oil and water.  
 
{{champion:145}} : I kid you not, after the kneejerk buffs on the patch after her release, she's only ever seen nerfs. There's a reason she was the most played ADC for two worlds in a row.

{{champion:142}} : ...  
 
{{champion:516}} : As much as I love my GOAT, man his W on release was not ok. It was basically a free trade at the press of a button.  
  
{{champion:141}}  : Literally has only seen buffs and bugfixes, which is doubly impressive given his two forms.

> {{champion:145}}  : I kid you not, after the kneejerk buffs on the patch after her release, she's only ever seen nerfs. There's a reason she was the most played ADC for two worlds in a row.

That patch was a monstrosity. Literally every part of her kit. Base stats, range, every ability, all buffed.

Kai'sa herself is already a monstrosity of a champion, let alone an ADC. She's basically what would happen if Riot were to give Kog'Maw any remotely reliable form of self-peel. 

I sometimes wish Riot stopped releasing generalist champions with +100 ways to overcome their weakness and gave us champions with actual definitive weaknesses (Ex. Sett being extremely weak to being kited and having very short range).

Well yes his fat ass shield seems broken as fuck but it wears of fast so it requires the player to actually use their brain when using it.

His W is fairly slow, very dodgeable, has a clear animation, and is heavily telegraphed - if his Grit is high he'll be looking for a shield.

Everyone I've seen complain about him in game is also facetanking the W and mindlessly using damage on his shield

On to Sett. He hs definitely not "the most balanced champion ever" He's sitting at a 50% WR and 60% delta on his first week(currently same stats as {{champion:523}}  who is getting nerfed). He is 100% going to see some nerfs.
